qas.question: What does the term "Moors" refer to?
What descent of Muslims does "Moors" refer to?
In Medieval and early Modern Europe what ethnicity were lumped together?

answers.text: Muslim Arabs, Berbers, Black Africans and Europeans

context: The term "Moors" has been used in Europe in a broader, somewhat <a4_0>derogatory<a4_0/> sense to refer to <a0_0>Muslims<a0_0/>, especially those of <a1_0>Arab or Berber descent<a1_0/>, whether living in <a3_0>North Africa or Iberia<a3_0/>. Moors were not a distinct or self-defined people. Medieval and early modern Europeans applied the name to <a2_0>Muslim Arabs, Berbers, Black Africans and Europeans<a2_0/> alike.
